What is Heat Flux?



















 
 








Table of Contents









What is Heat?

What is Flux?

What is Heat Flux?

Understanding Heat Transfer

Heat Flux Formula

Heat Flux vs Heat Flow

Heat Flux vs Convection

What are Flux Units?

What are Heat Flux Units?

How do we Measure Heat Flux?

Applications of Heat Flux














 
 






Introduction







First we need to know the basics.
















 
 






What is Heat?







Heat is simply the transfer of energy from a higher temperature object to a lower temperature object. As cited from Michael E. Browne, PhD, heat is the energy transferred between a system and its surroundings because of their temperature difference. For example, if you touch someone’s hand and it’s cold, you are transferring some of your heat from your hand to theirs. We produce heat (body heat) from calories.







What is Flux?







In this context flux is the process of traveling or passing through a surface or substance.

























 
 






Heat Flux







So what is heat flux?
















 
 






What is Heat Flux?







Heat flux or thermal flux, also known as heat flow density, is the rate at which heat is transferred per unit area, per unit time, through an object or substance, usually from a hotter to a colder area. It is typically measured in watts per square meter (W/m2) and is a measure of the energy flow through a material or system. Understanding heat flux is important in a wide range of applications, including thermal management, energy efficiency, and heat transfer.





































 
 






Understanding Heat Transfer







What are the three types of heat transfer?










Heat transfer is the transfer of thermal energy from one body to another. This can happen through three primary mechanisms: conduction, convection, and radiation. The rate of heat transfer, represented by the symbol Q, is the amount of heat that flows per unit of time. This flow of heat can be measured in various units, but one common unit is Btu/hr. This unit is often used in industrial applications where heat transfer rates are critical to the operation of machinery and systems.


Conduction is the transfer of heat through a material by the collision of atoms and molecules. The atoms and molecules in a material can absorb and transfer heat energy through collisions with neighboring atoms and molecules.

Convection is the transfer of heat through a fluid, such as a liquid or gas. Heat is transferred through the fluid by the movement of the fluid itself.

Radiation is the transfer of heat through electromagnetic waves. This is the mechanism by which heat is transferred through space, such as from the sun to the earth.

















 
 






Heat Flux Formula
























The heat flux formula is best described as Fourier’s Law: q = -λΔT/Δx = -0.8 * 20 / 0.35

The rate of heat transfer, represented by the symbol Q, is the amount of heat that flows per unit of time. This flow of heat can be measured in various units. This unit is often used in industrial applications where heat transfer rates are critical to the operation of machinery and systems.




q
=
heat flux


k
=
thermal conductivity


T
=
temperature



 













 
 






Heat Flux vs Heat Flow







The difference between heat flow and heat flux










Heat flow is the generation and exchange of thermal energy between physical systems. Heat flux is the flow of energy per unit of area, per unit of time.













 
 






Heat Flux vs Convection







The difference between heat flux and convection










Heat flux is a measure of the rate of heat transfer per unit area, while convection is a mode of heat transfer that occurs when a fluid is heated and rises, and as it cools, it sinks, leading to a continuous transfer of heat. In other words, heat flux is a scalar quantity that describes the flow of heat through a material, while convection refers to the movement of heat in a fluid, typically caused by differences in density.













 
 






Flux Units










What are Flux Units?







Flux units refer to the units used to measure the rate at which heat energy is transferred through a surface per unit area. The most common units of heat flux include watts per square meter (W/m2) and British thermal units per square foot per hour (Btu/ft2-hr).
















Heat Flux Units










What are Heat Flux Units?














A flow of energy per unit of area per unit of time is known as heat flux or thermal flux. It is also known as heat flux density, heat-flow density, or heat flow rate intensity. Watts per square meter (W/m2) are the SI units. It is a vector quantity since it has both a direction and a magnitude.



























 
 






Measuring Heat Flux







So how do we measure heat flux?










Heat flux can be measured using a variety of methods, depending on the specific application. Some common methods include:


Thermocouples are devices that measure the temperature difference between two points. They can be used to measure heat flux by placing a thermocouple on one side of a material and measuring the temperature difference between the thermocouple and the other side of the material.

Heat flux sensors are specialized devices that are designed specifically to measure heat flux. They typically include a heat-sensitive element, such as a thermocouple or thermistor, that is in contact with the material or system being measured.

Infrared imaging can also be used to measure heat flux. Infrared cameras can detect the temperature of a material or system and can be used to create a thermal map that shows the distribution of heat.

Applications of Heat Flux










Heat flux can be used in a variety of applications. Some common applications include:


HVAC Systems

Energy conservation and management in buildings

Automotive thermal management


















How Heat Flux Measurement Helps us Understand Batteries

Thermal insulation and building envelope performance

Quality control in manufacturing and materials testing

Biomedical research and medical device development

<h2>Introduction</h2>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h4>First we need to know the basics.</h4>

</div>

</div>

<div class="divider-wrap" data-alignment="default"><div style="margin-top: 12.5px; height: 1px; margin-bottom: 12.5px;" data-width="100%" data-animate data-animation-delay data-color="default" class="divider-border"></div>
</div>

<div id="heat" data-midnight data-column-margin="90px" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row  translate_y_-50px" style><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-6 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column padding-3-percent inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1670357848156 heat">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h6><strong>What is Heat?</strong></h6>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p>Heat is simply the transfer of energy from a higher temperature object to a lower temperature object. As cited from Michael E. Browne, PhD, heat is the energy transferred between a system and its surroundings because of their temperature difference. For example, if you touch someone’s hand and it’s cold, you are transferring some of your heat from your hand to theirs. We produce heat (body heat) from calories.</p>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1670358099461 #flux">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h6><strong>What is Flux?</strong></h6>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p>In this context flux is the process of traveling or passing through a surface or substance.</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="vc_col-sm-6 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="all" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="nectar-lottie-wrap width_desktop_60pct alignment_left translate_y_desktop_0px translate_y_phone_0px"><div class="nectar-lottie" data-lottie-settings='{"trigger_type":"play","mobile_func":"default","trigger_offset":"0.00,100.00","frame_constraint":"0.00,100.00","width_desktop":"60%","alignment":"left","preserve_aspect_ratio":"xMidYMid meet","translate_y_desktop":"0px","translate_y_phone":"0","json_url":"https:\/\/assets5.lottiefiles.com\/packages\/lf20_6di23gcc.json","box_shadow_method":"filter"}'></div>
</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>
<div id="fws_65a19ac77ef76" data-midnight data-column-margin="default" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" style><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-12 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1671728922214">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h2>Heat Flux</h2>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h4>So what is heat flux?</h4>

</div>

</div>

<div class="divider-wrap" data-alignment="default"><div style="margin-top: 12.5px; height: 1px; margin-bottom: 12.5px;" data-width="100%" data-animate data-animation-delay data-color="default" class="divider-border"></div>
</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>
<div id="hf" data-midnight data-column-margin="90px" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" style><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-6 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column padding-3-percent inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1670357842588 hf">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h6><strong>What is Heat Flux?</strong></h6>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p>Heat flux or thermal flux, also known as heat flow density,<strong> is the rate at which heat is transferred per unit area, per unit time, through an object or substance, usually from a hotter to a colder area.</strong> It is typically measured in watts per square meter (W/m2) and is a measure of the energy flow through a material or system. Understanding heat flux is important in a wide range of applications, including thermal management, energy efficiency, and heat transfer.</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="vc_col-sm-6 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="all" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="img-with-aniamtion-wrap " data-max-width="75%" data-max-width-mobile="default" data-shadow="none" data-animation="none">
<div class="inner">
<div class="hover-wrap">
<div class="hover-wrap-inner">
<a href="https://huksefluxusa.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Heat-flux-diagram-01.jpg" class="pp " title="Heat Flux is the transfer of heat through a surface or substance. There are three different of measurable heat fluxes, radiative, convective, and conductive." target="_blank">

<div id="three-types" data-midnight data-column-margin="default" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" style><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-12 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1674745173023">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h2>Understanding Heat Transfer</h2>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h4>What are the three types of heat transfer?</h4>

</div>

</div>

<div class="divider-wrap" data-alignment="default"><div style="margin-top: 12.5px; height: 1px; margin-bottom: 12.5px;" data-width="100%" data-animate data-animation-delay data-color="default" class="divider-border"></div>
</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p><a href="https://www.weather.gov/jetstream/heat" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Heat</a> transfer is the transfer of thermal energy from one body to another. This can happen through <a href="https://huksefluxusa.com/learn/3-types-of-heat-transfer/" target="_blank">three primary mechanisms</a>: conduction, convection, and radiation. The rate of heat transfer, represented by the symbol Q, is the amount of heat that flows per unit of time. This flow of heat can be measured in various units, but one common unit is Btu/hr. This unit is often used in industrial applications where heat transfer rates are critical to the operation of machinery and systems.</p>

<ul>
<li><a href="https://huksefluxusa.com/learn/3-types-of-heat-transfer/#conduction" target="_blank"><strong>Conduction</strong></a> is the transfer of heat through a material by the collision of atoms and molecules. The atoms and molecules in a material can absorb and transfer heat energy through collisions with neighboring atoms and molecules.</li>

<li><a href="https://huksefluxusa.com/learn/3-types-of-heat-transfer/#convection" target="_blank"><strong>Convection</strong></a> is the transfer of heat through a fluid, such as a liquid or gas. Heat is transferred through the fluid by the movement of the fluid itself.</li>

<li><a href="https://huksefluxusa.com/learn/3-types-of-heat-transfer/#radiation" target="_blank"><strong>Radiation</strong></a> is the transfer of heat through electromagnetic waves. This is the mechanism by which heat is transferred through space, such as from the sun to the earth.</li>

</ul>
</div>

</div>

<div class="nectar-lottie-wrap alignment_center translate_y_desktop_-43px translate_y_phone_0px"><div class="nectar-lottie" data-lottie-settings='{"trigger_type":"play","mobile_func":"default","loop":"true","trigger_offset":"0.00,100.00","frame_constraint":"0.00,100.00","alignment":"center","preserve_aspect_ratio":"xMidYMid meet","translate_y_desktop":"-43px","translate_y_phone":"0","json_url":"https:\/\/assets4.lottiefiles.com\/packages\/lf20_ofxzkdhh.json","box_shadow_method":"filter"}'></div>
</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>
<div id="heat_flux_formula" data-midnight data-column-margin="default" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" style><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-12 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1671728913960">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h2>Heat Flux Formula</h2>

</div>

</div>

<div class="divider-wrap" data-alignment="default"><div style="margin-top: 12.5px; height: 1px; margin-bottom: 12.5px;" data-width="100%" data-animate data-animation-delay data-color="default" class="divider-border"></div>

<img decoding="async" class="img-with-animation skip-lazy  nectar-lazy" data-delay="0" height="403" width="600" data-animation="none" data-nectar-img-src="https://huksefluxusa.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/ezgif.com-gif-maker-34-600x403.webp" src="data:image/svg+xml;charset=utf-8,%3Csvg%20xmlns%3D'http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg'%20viewBox%3D'0%200%20600%20403'%2F%3E" alt="Heat Flux Formula" data-nectar-img-srcset="https://huksefluxusa.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/ezgif.com-gif-maker-34-600x403.webp 600w, https://huksefluxusa.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/ezgif.com-gif-maker-34-900x604.webp 900w, https://huksefluxusa.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/ezgif.com-gif-maker-34-400x269.webp 400w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px">

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p>The heat flux formula is best described as Fourier’s Law: <em>q = -λΔT/Δx = -0.8 * 20 / 0.35</em></p>

<p>The rate of heat transfer, represented by the symbol Q, is the amount of heat that flows per unit of time. This flow of heat can be measured in various units. This unit is often used in industrial applications where heat transfer rates are critical to the operation of machinery and systems.</p>

<div id="hfvshf" data-midnight data-column-margin="default" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" style><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-12 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1670357861485 hfvshf">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h2>Heat Flux vs Heat Flow</h2>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h4>The difference between heat flow and heat flux</h4>

</div>

</div>

<div class="divider-wrap" data-alignment="default"><div style="margin-top: 12.5px; height: 1px; margin-bottom: 12.5px;" data-width="100%" data-animate data-animation-delay data-color="default" class="divider-border"></div>
</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p>Heat flow is the generation and exchange of thermal energy between physical systems. Heat flux is the flow of energy per unit of area, per unit of time.</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>
<div id="hfvsc" data-midnight data-column-margin="default" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" style><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-12 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1675786329203 hfvshf">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h2><a href="https://huksefluxusa.com/learn/heat-flux-vs-convection-whats-the-difference/" target="_blank">Heat Flux vs Convection</a></h2>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h4>The difference between heat flux and convection</h4>

</div>

</div>

<div class="divider-wrap" data-alignment="default"><div style="margin-top: 12.5px; height: 1px; margin-bottom: 12.5px;" data-width="100%" data-animate data-animation-delay data-color="default" class="divider-border"></div>
</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p>Heat flux is a measure of the rate of heat transfer per unit area, while convection is a mode of heat transfer that occurs when a fluid is heated and rises, and as it cools, it sinks, leading to a continuous transfer of heat. In other words, heat flux is a scalar quantity that describes the flow of heat through a material, while convection refers to the movement of heat in a fluid, typically caused by differences in density.</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>
<div id="flux-units" data-midnight data-column-margin="default" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" style><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-6 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1674049592382 hfvshf">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h2>Flux Units</h2>

</div>

</div>

<div class="divider-wrap" data-alignment="default"><div style="margin-top: 12.5px; height: 1px; margin-bottom: 12.5px;" data-width="100%" data-animate data-animation-delay data-color="default" class="divider-border"></div>
</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1674056418585 hfunits">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h6 id="2-what-are-heat-flux-units"><strong>What are Flux Units?</strong></h6>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p>Flux units refer to the units used to measure the rate at which heat energy is transferred through a surface per unit area. The most common units of heat flux include watts per square meter (W/m2) and British thermal units per square foot per hour (Btu/ft2-hr).</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="vc_col-sm-6 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="all" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1674056761418 hfvshf">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h2>Heat Flux Units</h2>

</div>

</div>

<div class="divider-wrap" data-alignment="default"><div style="margin-top: 12.5px; height: 1px; margin-bottom: 12.5px;" data-width="100%" data-animate data-animation-delay data-color="default" class="divider-border"></div>
</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1674056535601 hfunits">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h6 id="2-what-are-heat-flux-units"><strong>What are Heat Flux Units?</strong></h6>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div id="hfvshf" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" data-midnight data-column-margin="default">
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12 left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-12 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p>A flow of energy per unit of area per unit of time is known as heat flux or thermal flux. It is also known as heat flux density, heat-flow density, or heat flow rate intensity. Watts per square meter (W/m2) are the SI units. It is a vector quantity since it has both a direction and a magnitude.</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>
<div id="measure" data-midnight data-column-margin="default" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" style="padding-top: 3em; "><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
<div class="vc_col-sm-12 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column no-extra-padding inherit_tablet inherit_phone " data-padding-pos="bottom" data-has-bg-color="false" data-bg-color data-bg-opacity="1" data-animation data-delay="0">
<div class="vc_column-inner">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element  vc_custom_1674745000194 measure">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h2>Measuring Heat Flux</h2>

</div>

</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<h5>So how do we measure heat flux?</h5>

</div>

</div>

<div class="divider-wrap" data-alignment="default"><div style="margin-top: 12.5px; height: 1px; margin-bottom: 12.5px;" data-width="100%" data-animate data-animation-delay data-color="default" class="divider-border"></div>
</div>

<div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element ">
<div class="wpb_wrapper">
<p>Heat flux can be measured using a variety of methods, depending on the specific application. Some common methods include:</p>

<ul>
<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thermocouple" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>Thermocouples</strong></a> are devices that measure the temperature difference between two points. They can be used to measure heat flux by placing a thermocouple on one side of a material and measuring the temperature difference between the thermocouple and the other side of the material.</li>

<li><a href="https://huksefluxusa.com/product-category/products/heat-flux-products/heat-flux-sensors/" target="_blank"><strong>Heat flux sensors</strong></a> are specialized devices that are designed specifically to measure heat flux. They typically include a heat-sensitive element, such as a thermocouple or thermistor, that is in contact with the material or system being measured.</li>

<li><a href="https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/chemistry/infrared-imaging#:~:text=Infrared%20(IR)%20imaging%20technology%20is,more%20IR%20radiation%20it%20emits." target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>Infrared imaging</strong></a> can also be used to measure heat flux. Infrared cameras can detect the temperature of a material or system and can be used to create a thermal map that shows the distribution of heat.</li>

</ul>
</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>
<div id="measure" data-midnight data-column-margin="default" class="wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_row inner_row" style="padding-top: 3em; "><div class="row-bg-wrap"> <div class="row-bg"></div>
 </div>
<div class="row_col_wrap_12_inner col span_12  left">
